channel.title: Money Laundering on ECTHRwatch
channel.description: Recent content in Money Laundering on ECTHRwatch

item.title: Money Laundering
item.description: INTERPOL - Money Laundering Click on this link to visualize the original document: INTERPOL_Money_Laundering.pdf “Going back to the roots The investigation of money laundering usually goes hand in hand with the investigation of the original crime generating the proceeds. Financial investigations aim to identify the origins, flows and whereabouts of illicit income and unmask the networks involved. Illegally acquired assets can then be frozen or confiscated and the perpetrators of both the original offences and the subsequent money laundering prosecuted.

item.title: Email sent to the F.B.I. about Xi Jinping (习近平), the President of the People’s Republic of China, and Li Keqiang (李克强), the Premier of the State Council of the People’s Republic of China.
item.description:
On 2022-03-11, I sent 3 emails to the F.B.I.

This is the second email which was sent at 16:36 Beijing time. It was sent to Messrs. Rogalski and Manjarrez. It’s about the XiJinping.fr and LiKeqiang.org websites.

From: [Key witness/whistleblower’s name, redacted for privacy]

TO : [Mr. Rogalski’s username]@state.gov

TO : [Mr. Manjarrez’s username]@fbi.gov

SUBJECT: XiJinping.fr and LiKeqiang.org

item.title: Reply from McDonald’s Global Compliance Office
item.description: From: McDonald’s Global Compliance Office (business.integrity@us.mcd.com) Subject: Re: Have you received my communications? Please acknowledge receipt. Date received: November 19, 2019 at 01:19 (Beijing time) To: [Key witness/whistleblower’s name, redacted for privacy] [Victim’s first name] - Our apologies for not responding, however, it appears that we did not receive your communications. Could you provide us with the information that you previously provided? Thanks. Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2019-11-19-reply-from-mcdonalds-global-compliance-office_Redacted.pdf

item.title: Email to McDonald’s Global Compliance Office
item.description: From: [Key witness/whistleblower’s name, redacted for privacy] Subject: Have you received my communications? Please acknowledge receipt. Date sent: November 18, 2019, 23:16 (Beijing time) To: business.integrity@us.mcd.com (McDonald’s Global Compliance Office) Dear Sir or Madam, Have you received my communications? I would appreciate if you would confirm the receipt of the emails I’ve sent to you. Have all of the Members of the Board of McDonald’s Corporation been notified? It’s important for all of them to be notified of what’s going on.
